intro: Ageratina nesomii, commonly known as the Hawaiian blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, blue-violet flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in compact, spherical clusters. Ageratina nesomii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
